text: Update: these will need R Core support to work on and they might consider them unsuitable for external contributors to get involved with, given the stage they are at (need discussion/review) and the potential knock-on effect on a lot of code. However, I am running them past Tomas to see if they may be considered for group discussion led by R Core.

elements.text: Update: these will need R Core support to work on and they might consider them unsuitable for external contributors to get involved with, given the stage they are at (need discussion/review) and the potential knock-on effect on a lot of code. However, I am running them past Tomas to see if they may be considered for group discussion led by R Core.

text: Sure, even if not explicitly being worked on, some discussion to provide a way forward would be great. Especially the oldest bug, would be interesting to explore. I suspect that some of these more esoteric issues don't get considered in the normal course given more pressing priorities

elements.text: Sure, even if not explicitly being worked on, some discussion to provide a way forward would be great. Especially the oldest bug, would be interesting to explore. I suspect that some of these more esoteric issues don't get considered in the normal course given more pressing priorities

text: we don't necessarily need to add them as a bug to fix from my perspective - it's the discussion and getting views from R core which is more relevant here - there may not be code changes merited, perhaps just documentation

elements.text: we don't necessarily need to add them as a bug to fix from my perspective - it's the discussion and getting views from R core which is more relevant here - there may not be code changes merited, perhaps just documentation

text: Unfortunately Tomas does not think it will be helpful to discuss these at the the sprint. They would require lengthy discussion with several rounds of CRAN/Bioc checks to see what breaks, which takes days. He is sympathetic to the idea of wanting to document it, but "Documenting the mess would make it harder to fix it in the future and would only invite more (ab)use - depending more on it. That's why these are hard to make any progress on."

elements.text: Unfortunately Tomas does not think it will be helpful to discuss these at the the sprint. They would require lengthy discussion with several rounds of CRAN/Bioc checks to see what breaks, which takes days. He is sympathetic to the idea of wanting to document it, but "Documenting the mess would make it harder to fix it in the future and would only invite more (ab)use - depending more on it. That's why these are hard to make any progress on."

text: So you might get somewhere talking to specific individuals about them, but I don't think these are going to be selected for special attention at the sprint.
